result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:05 AM Defendant Steven Loren Lofgren-Zappitello appeared by video, in custody.   Attorney Nathan M Cockerham appeared by video.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Cockerham  acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea to all counts.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.    Attny Cockerham indicates speedy trial request was filed.  Court makes record to scheduling to go outside of time limits.  Jury Trial is set.    Court orders Motion in Limine, Special Verdict Forms, Witness List and Jury Instructions to be filed by Friday, July 22, 2022.
Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Final pre-trial on August 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Jury trial on August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference on June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
REACHED OUT TO ATTORNEY COCKERHAM AND DA'S OFFICE TO SEE HOW MANY DAYS WOULD BE NEEDED FOR JURY TRAIL (SPEEDY DEMAND). -AMA
Arraignment on May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:56 AM Defendant Steven Loren Lofgren-Zappitello appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail, with Attorney Nathan M Cockerham appeared by video. Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Cockerham indicates DEF would like to proceed with preliminary hearing.  10:56AM State calls Investigator Zachary Zaug.  Court swears in witness.  State questions witness.  

11:01AM OFF THE RECORD, video connection with Atty Cockerham lost.  

11:03AM BACK ON THE RECORD - Appearances remain unchanged.  State continues questioning witness.  11:09AM Witness identifies DEF.  State continues questioning witness.  11:10AM State tenders witness, Atty Cockerham cross examines witness.  11:12AM State objects, irrelevant.  Atty Cockerham responds.  Court makes statement, question is not relevant in a preliminary hearing. Atty Cockerham withdraws question, continues cross-examination of witness. 11:19 AM Atty Cockerham tenders witness.  Witness excused.  State has no argument, requests bind over. Atty Cockerham makes argument, requests no bind over, jurisdictional issue on count 1 and State failed to meet burden of victim for count 2.  State responds to each issue raised by Atty Cockerham, requests bind over.  Court makes statement.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.  Court sets ARGN for 5/31/22 at 10:00AM.
Arraignment scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

DEF not to possess any electronic devices for access to internet.   Except for ligament work purposes.

No contact with any juvenile under the age of 17 years old.

9:04 AM Defendant Steven Loren Lofgren-Zappitello appeared by video, in custody .Attorney Nathan M Cockerham appeared by telephone.   Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Cockerham indicates spoke to Attny Chapman (Court appointed Attny) and Attny Cockerham will be handling case as private hire. Clerk to enter end date for Attny Chapman.   DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Attny Cockerham makes bond modification argument.  State makes bond argument and objects.   Court denies bond adjustment, but modifies bond conditions.  Conditions modified:   DEF not to possess any electronic devices for access to internet.   Except for ligament work purposes.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 29, 2022 at 10:45 am.
